div.ab: At MALAGA an arabian palace the Alcacaba Alcazaba (Citadel) now the new custom house. In castle a sort of chimney over every window & door running up to battlements to throw stones down. Gibralfaro.
Santa Fé 2 leagues from Granada
Earthquake in 1809. Church cut in 2.
Muley Hasen Mulhacén peak 12 762 feet from sea. Picacho de Veleta Peak of Veleta 12 459.
general run 1824 & 1781 fathoms
Mt Perdu Mont Perdu / Monte Perdido top of Spanish Pyrenees 1763 fathoms. Muleyhasen Mulhacén 1824. 76 fathoms lower than Teneriffe.
Sierra de Gador near Almeria 7.800 feet.

Rock of Filabres 2 000 feet high. 4 miles round. Almeria taken 1147 by Alfonso & a fleet of Genoese. Garnets i.e. gemstones near Capo di Gata Cabo de Gata. Near T de las Guardas is jasper near T. de White carnelian Neste Torre de las Guardas Tower of the Guards and Torre de Neste Tower of Neste.
Precious stones in cavern of Bujo.
In puerto de la plata Puerto de la Plata Moorish corsairs. near it in rock el monte de las guardas Guards' Mount amethysts. Alpuxarras Alpujarras lie between Sierras Nevada & de Gador.

At Concud human bones &c. Soto di RomaSoto de Roma, a royal estate outside Granada granted to the retired minister Ricardo Wall (1694-1777). Mr Wall. 4000 acres of forest. Pheasants. died in 1778. wento i.e. went to Godoy Manuel Godoy, Spanish minister, inherited Soto de Roma after Ricardo Wall's death. road from Sa Fe to a venta on rio Saladillo Santa Fe to a country inn on the river Saltillo from salt springs of Almaha. Loxa Loja & its moorish castle in pass 9000 souls. Chiuma Possibly Churriana, at the mouth of the Guadalhorce. has 8000 souls. river Guadalhorce.
A french Knight & Moorish princess fled from Granada to pena de los enamorados Lovers' Rock [pena = peña], by tradition.
Antiquera Antequera Anticaria 8000 families 40000 souls, taken 80 years before Granada by Juan II. In Moorish castle which is very perfect is armour. short javelins. Xbows crossbows oval shields
div.label: Antequera
div.ab: made of two hides musket proof. The entry called the giants arch. Mosque perfect. fountains. Fuente de la PiedraStone Fountain.
FONTI DIVINO ARAM L. POSTUMIUS STATULIUS EX VOTO .D.D.D. Lucius Postumius Statulius gifted and dedicated (dono dedit et dedicavit) the altar of this divine fountain as a votive offering.
Alora 4 leagues from Antequera 4 000 souls.
arabs of Syria of the Ommiades Umayyads.
house of Abbas used drawing: arch ???
Ronda 20000 souls. encircled by Guadiaro connected with country by an drawing: arch bridge 120 feet high 2d drawing:arch bridge 280 feet arch 110 feet diamdiameter?
Alameda The Alameda del Tajo, Ronda has a precipice of 500 feet

all the rivers of Ronda fall into the cueva del GatoCat's cave. a mile through which is a lake with ruins of antiquity. beyond this deep lake passage of water too small to penetrate 4 miles from cave the river again comes out & runs by AlgaucinProbably Gaucín. The comment on civility is not in Conder and may be WG's own recollection.. Civil people.
Algaucin 10 000 souls.
div.note: This whole section summarises and paraphrases Josiah Conder, The Modern Traveller. A Description, Geographical, Historical, and Topographical, of the Various Countries of the Globe, 30 vols (London, 1830), vol. 18: Spain and Portugal, pp. 11, 273-87, 293-5, 300. WG's observations and facts are always in the same order as Conder's. Conder's book, a compendium of existing accounts, draws on Jacob (above all), Swinburne, Dillon, Cavanah Murphy, Peyron, Laborde and Bourgoing in these passages.
div.ab: Drum of Almansor.
div.note: Arabic Al-Mansur [Almanzor] lost a drum at Calatañazor [the supposed battle of 1002, since proven a fiction]
div.ab: Almansar Khasara Tabluhu fi Calcanassar
Drums invented by Arabs

This is called so by Spaniards In reference to 'Calcanassar' (Calatañazor) but it was Kalat Anesor vide Conde Chap CII p 543 Vol I.See Conde, Historia de la dominacion, vol. 1, p. 543: chapter 102, 'De la batalla de Calat Anosor y muerte de Almanzor' (On the battle of Calat Anosor and the death of Almanzor)
